channel.title: Item slots and glitches
channel.description: Hello got problems with items. When i wear some item like Ringmaster shirt it wears in my ring slot. idk how to fix it. and when i wear pernix cowl , my player head looks weird. i want to fix these problems please help me do it.? :confused:

item.title: Item slots and glitches
item.dc:creator: @David321 David321
item.description:
@David321 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:19, topic:427697”]You can still add models.
And if the model ints are in itemdef.java you can fix them in item.cfg and item.java.[/quote]

okay i will try.

Read full topic

item.title: Item slots and glitches
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You can still add models.
And if the model ints are in itemdef.java you can fix them in item.cfg and item.java.

Read full topic

item.description:
@David321 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:13, topic:427697”]Essentially yes. But you need to copy + paste the ints and every thing else I said.
And everyone else that plays needs to get a new cache when you update it.[/quote]

In my Raw folder inst any models

item.title: Item slots and glitches
item.dc:creator: @David321 David321
item.description:
@David321 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:11, topic:427697”]You add the models to Raw folder of the cache.
Add the int’s to ItemDef.java
Add item to Item.cfg
Make sure it goes in the correct slot by adding it to Item.java[/quote]

I can just downlaod models and put them in?

Read full topic

item.title: Item slots and glitches
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You add the models to Raw folder of the cache.
Add the int’s to ItemDef.java
Add item to Item.cfg
Make sure it goes in the correct slot by adding it to Item.java

Read full topic

item.title: Item slots and glitches
item.dc:creator: @David321 David321
item.description:
@David321 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:9, topic:427697”]It’s probably hard coded like all the other bull shit in the new clients.
Open item.java and add Perinx Cowl to this: public static boolean playerHats(int itemId)
That’s where mine is.[/quote]

Did you got glitch too? i mean i added but it dont work. is there any tutorial how to add models to Pi server? i need one . please.

Read full topic

item.title: Item slots and glitches
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

It’s probably hard coded like all the other bull shit in the new clients.
Open item.java and add Perinx Cowl to this: public static boolean playerHats(int itemId)
That’s where mine is.

Read full topic

item.title: Item slots and glitches
item.dc:creator: @David321 David321
item.description:
@David321 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:7, topic:427697”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=530392.msg3873428#msg3873428 date=1325511910]

Create a switch case in itemAssitant.java handling it. In the void wearItem[code] switch(wearID) {

			case 11022:
				targetSlot = 7;
				break;[/code]

Is that seriously how bases are doing it now-a-days?
[/quote]
No. I’ve never seen a base do it like that. Mine is dealt with in my item.java lol[/quote]

My serevr is PI based one. Pernix cowl is glitchy and are there any models for it?

Read full topic
